Title: The Last Command
Cast: Emil Jannings, Evelyn Brent, William Powell, Jack Raymond, Nicholas Soussanin, Michael Visaroff, Fritz Feld, Robert Wilber
Plot: A former Imperial Russian general and cousin of the Czar ends up in Hollywood as an extra in a movie directed by a former revolutionary. A decorated, aristocratic Czarist General is reduced to penury after the collapse of Imperial Russia. An old adversary, now a successful director hires the general to re-enact the revolution which deposed him. Written by W. Louis <wlouis@ego.psych.mcgill.ca>
Keywords: hollywood, bolshevik, whip, riding crop, indignity
Location: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
Actors: Emil Jannings, Evelyn Brent, William Powell
Writer: Lajos Biró (story), John F. Goodrich | 2 more credits »
Description: Directed by Josef von Sternberg.  With Emil Jannings, Evelyn Brent, William Powell, Jack Raymond. A former Imperial Russian general and cousin of the Czar ends up in Hollywood as an extra in a movie directed by a former revolutionary.
